column4: Description
column9: Test Instructions
column10: Notes

column4: Enable multi-image upload - also fix 401 Unauthorized error when creating listings. Add Year Built and Garage Spaces fields. Fix Spread and ROI calculations.
column9:
1) Login as wholesaler.pro@test.com (Pro wholesaler test account).
2) Navigate to Post a Deal page (/my-listings/new).
3) Fill out listing form with required fields (address, city, state, zip, price).
4) Set Year Built = 2005 and Garage Spaces = 3.
5) Upload multiple images (3-5 photos) - verify all images upload successfully.
6) Submit listing form.
7) Verify NO 401 Unauthorized error - listing should create successfully.
8) Verify listing appears in my-listings page.
9) View listing detail page and verify:
   - All images display in carousel
   - Year Built shows '2005'
   - Garage shows '3 spaces'
   - Spread calculates correctly: ARV - Purchase Price
   - ROI calculates correctly: (Net Profit / Total Investment) × 100
   - No NaN or incorrect values displayed
10) Check browser console for any auth errors.
column10: ✅ COMPLETE: CreateListingForm supports multiple images and uploads successfully. Fixed 401 error by adding Authorization header support in POST /api/listings route and frontend fetch call. Route now uses dual auth (cookies + Authorization header fallback). Added Year Built and Garage Spaces optional fields to form. Fixed Spread calculation (ARV - Purchase Price) and ROI calculation (accounts for repairs in total investment). All fields display on listing detail page with proper N/A fallbacks.

column4: 401 Unauthorized for notifications/messages APIs and unknown sign-in loop behavior even for logged-in wholesaler accounts.
column9:
1) Login as wholesaler.free@test.com on Vercel prod.
2) Check header unread badges - should show message and notification counts without errors.
3) Open `/messages` and verify:
   - No redirect loop or sign-in loop.
   - No repeated 401s in console for `/api/notifications` or `/api/messages`.
   - Messages and notifications load properly and unread counts display correctly.
   - Conversations list renders without crashing.
column10: All routes updated to use createServerClient() from @/supabase/server. Unread-count endpoints return { count: 0 } on error (never 401). Messages page uses redirectRef to prevent loops. Header component handles errors gracefully. RLS policies allow users to read their own messages/notifications. Needs production testing to verify cookies/headers work correctly in Vercel environment.

column4: 401 Unauthorized when hitting analytics as a normal wholesaler; analytics should be available to any signed-in user (tier aware if needed).
column9:
1) Login as wholesaler.free@test.com on Vercel prod.
2) Open `/analytics`.
3) Verify:
   - API call to `/api/analytics` returns 200 (not 401).
   - Charts/metrics render without errors.
   - Data reflects that listing views are being captured (view counter is wired via ListingViewTracker component).
   - ViewsReceived metric shows correct total from all user's listings.
column10: Analytics API route uses createServerClient() with Authorization header fallback. Removed Pro gate from analytics layout. All authenticated users can now access analytics. Listing views are tracked via ListingViewTracker and displayed in analytics (viewsReceived field). Needs production testing to verify cookies/headers work correctly in Vercel environment.

column4: Listing view tracking - ensure views are correctly recorded and can be used for analytics charts.
column9:
1) Open a listing detail page (e.g., /listing/[id]) several times.
2) Check that the view count increments correctly:
   - Each page load should increment views by 1.
   - Views should persist after page refresh.
   - Check Supabase listings table - views column should increment.
3) Open `/analytics` and verify:
   - viewsReceived metric shows updated counts.
   - topViewedListings array includes listings with highest view counts.
   - averageViewsPerListing is calculated correctly.
column10: View tracking implemented: POST /api/listings/[id]/view increments views column atomically. ListingViewTracker component calls this endpoint once per page load. Views are included in analytics API (viewsReceived
column12: averageViewsPerListing). RLS policies allow UPDATE on views for live listings. Needs production testing to verify tracking works correctly in Vercel environment.

column4: Heatmap of investor interest based on listing views - higher views = stronger heat intensity.
column9:
1) Login as wholesaler or investor.
2) Open `/analytics/heatmap`.
3) Verify:
   - Heatmap displays with color gradient (blue to red).
   - Intensity is based on listing view counts (higher views = stronger heat).
   - Wholesalers see their own listings with view-based intensity.
   - Investors see all live listings with view-based intensity.
   - Map bounds auto-fit to show all listings with data.
4) Test with listings that have different view counts:
   - Open a listing multiple times to increase its view count.
   - Refresh the heatmap page and verify the heat intensity for that listing's location has increased.
column10: Heatmap API endpoint created: GET /api/analytics/heatmap returns listings with lat/lng and views. HeatmapClient component uses Google Maps HeatmapLayer with weighted points based on views (logarithmic normalization). Gradient from blue (low views) to red (high views). Wholesalers see their listings; investors see all live listings. View tracking must be working for heatmap to show meaningful data. Needs production testing to verify visualization works correctly in Vercel environment.

column4: Define Redfin/Zillow-style design system for Off Axis (spacing, font sizes, weights, colors, shadows, card radius)
column9: 1) Review Redfin and Zillow design systems. 2) Create design system documentation with spacing, typography, color, shadow, and radius tokens. 3) Apply design system to existing components. 4) Verify consistency across all pages.
column10: Design system should feel polished and trustworthy like Redfin/Zillow while maintaining Off Axis brand colors.

column4: Standardize global typography scale and spacing tokens across web app

column10: Typography and spacing should be consistent throughout the application.

column10: Cards should feel premium and polished like Redfin/Zillow.

column10: Top bar should be intuitive and prominent like Redfin/Zillow.

column10: Top bar must work seamlessly on all devices.

column10: Search should feel instant and responsive.

column4: Implement full-bleed map layout on desktop and mobile (map filling most of the screen)

column10: Clustering improves performance and UX with many listings.

column4: Add Search this area auto-trigger when the map viewport changes
column9: 1) Detect map viewport changes. 2) Auto-trigger search for listings in viewport. 3) Verify debouncing prevents excessive API calls. 4) Test on desktop and mobile.
column10: Auto-search improves discovery experience.

column4: Ensure search/filter state stays in sync with map viewport and list
column9: 1) Search for a location - verify map and list sync. 2) Pan map - verify list updates. 3) Apply filters - verify map markers update. 4) Verify state persists across page refreshes.
column10: Map and list should always be in sync.

column4: Optimize map performance (debouncing, reduced re-renders, lazy loading)
column9: 1) Profile map performance. 2) Implement debouncing for viewport changes. 3) Reduce unnecessary re-renders. 4) Implement lazy loading for markers. 5) Verify performance improvements.
column10: Map should be smooth and responsive.

column4: Design bottom navigation bar inspired by Redfin/Zillow with 4-5 tabs (e.g., Find Homes, Feed, Favorites, My Deals/Saved, Profile)
column9: 1) Design bottom navigation with appropriate tabs. 2) Verify icons are clear and intuitive. 3) Test navigation flow between tabs. 4) Verify active state is clear.
column10: Bottom nav should follow mobile app patterns.

column4: Implement bottom navigation for mobile web (and later native mobile app)
column9: 1) Implement bottom navigation component. 2) Add to mobile layout. 3) Test navigation between sections. 4) Verify it doesn't interfere with content. 5) Test on various mobile devices.
column10: Bottom nav improves mobile UX significantly.

column4: Ensure each tab routes to the correct section and preserves filters/state where appropriate
column9: 1) Test navigation to each tab. 2) Verify routes are correct. 3) Test that filters/state persist when navigating. 4) Verify back button behavior.
column10: State preservation improves UX.

column4: Design property card layout (price, beds/baths, address, badges, quick actions)
column9: 1) Design card layout matching Redfin/Zillow quality. 2) Include price, beds/baths, address prominently. 3) Add badges for featured, new, etc. 4) Add quick actions (favorite, share). 5) Verify information hierarchy is clear.
column10: Cards should be scannable and actionable.

column4: Implement property card component for list view and map-linked results
column9: 1) Create property card component. 2) Use in list view. 3) Link cards to map markers. 4) Verify clicking card highlights marker. 5) Verify clicking marker highlights card.
column10: Cards should integrate seamlessly with map.

column4: Update listing detail page layout with clear sections (photos, key stats, AI tools, contact options)
column9: 1) Design detail page layout. 2) Organize into clear sections. 3) Verify photos are prominent. 4) Verify key stats are easy to scan. 5) Verify AI tools and contact options are accessible.
column10: Detail page should be well-organized like Redfin/Zillow.

column4: Ensure consistent use of card components on listing detail sub-sections (comps, repair estimate, notes, etc.)
column9: 1) Identify all sub-sections on detail page. 2) Apply card components consistently. 3) Verify visual consistency. 4) Test on mobile and desktop.
column10: Consistency improves visual polish.

column4: Add subtle loading animations (skeletons/fade-ins) for map and list results
column9: 1) Create skeleton loader components. 2) Apply to map loading. 3) Apply to list loading. 4) Verify animations are smooth. 5) Test on slow connections.
column10: Loading states improve perceived performance.

column4: Implement marker selection animation (highlight selected property on map and in list)
column9: 1) Click listing card - verify marker highlights. 2) Click marker - verify card highlights. 3) Verify animation is smooth. 4) Verify highlight is clear and visible.
column10: Selection feedback improves UX.

column4: Implement polished favorite heart animation and state syncing
column9: 1) Click favorite button. 2) Verify heart animation is smooth. 3) Verify state syncs across devices. 4) Verify favorite persists after refresh. 5) Test favorite/unfavorite flow.
column10: Favorite animation should feel delightful.

column4: Implement smooth transitions when switching between tabs (e.g., fade/slide)
column9: 1) Navigate between tabs. 2) Verify transitions are smooth. 3) Verify no jarring jumps. 4) Test on mobile and desktop.
column10: Smooth transitions improve polish.

column4: Create a UX review checklist explicitly comparing Off Axis vs. Redfin/Zillow
column9: 1) Document Redfin/Zillow UX patterns. 2) Create comparison checklist. 3) Review Off Axis against checklist. 4) Document gaps and improvements needed.
column10: Checklist ensures we match quality standards.

column4: Run a UX pass on all critical flows (search, filter, map, view listing, save, contact)
column9: 1) Test search flow end-to-end. 2) Test filter flow. 3) Test map interaction flow. 4) Test listing detail flow. 5) Test save/contact flows. 6) Document issues.
column10: Critical flows must be polished.

column4: Fix identified UI/UX issues from this pass and track them individually as sub-tasks
column9: 1) Prioritize identified issues. 2) Fix high-priority issues. 3) Track fixes in task system. 4) Verify improvements. 5) Continue iterating.
column10: Continuous improvement based on UX review.

column4: Document detailed feature matrix for Free, Basic, and Pro tiers (including limits and caps)

column4: Write clear marketing copy for each tier explaining value for wholesalers and investors
column9: 1) Write value proposition for Free tier. 2) Write value proposition for Basic tier. 3) Write value proposition for Pro tier. 4) Ensure copy speaks to wholesaler and investor needs. 5) Test copy clarity with users.
column10: Copy should clearly communicate value.

column4: Update pricing page UI to reflect tiers and benefits

column4: Implement Free tier limits: searches, map interactions, AI comps per day, saved properties, notifications
column9: 1) Implement search limit tracking. 2) Implement map interaction limits. 3) Implement AI comp daily limits. 4) Implement saved property limits. 5) Implement notification limits. 6) Test limits are enforced.
column10: Free tier limits drive upgrades.

column4: Add in-product messaging when a Free user hits limits (upsell to Basic/Pro)

column4: Ensure Free tier still delivers real value (not a demo only experience)

column4: Enable advanced map filters for Basic and above (price, property type, strategy tags, etc.)

column4: Increase saved property limits for Basic users

column10: Higher limits add value to Basic tier.

column4: Allow 5-10 AI comps per day (configurable limit) for Basic users

column4: Enable repair estimator feature for Basic and above
column9: 1) Verify repair estimator is gated. 2) Enable for Basic+ users. 3) Show upgrade prompt for Free users. 4) Test feature access.

column4: Enable unlimited searches and saved properties for Pro

column4: Implement contact info lookup for Pro, constrained to what's legally allowed (no illegal data)

column4: Add bulk export capabilities (CSV/API) gated to Pro

column4: Enable heatmaps and investor analytics for Pro (e.g., buy box heat, activity maps)
